center;” custom_css_main_element_tablet=”font-family: ‘trashhand’;||display: inline-block;”]Thinking about sending a nude?[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color_last_edited=”off|desktop” text_font_size_tablet=”” text_font_size_phone=”28px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” text_orientation_tablet=”” text_orientation_phone=”center” text_orientation_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: %22trashhand%22;” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Here’s five quick things to ask yourself before you hit SEND…

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_slider use_bg_overlay=”off” use_text_overlay=”off” arrows_custom_color=”#ffffff” disabled_on=”on|on|on” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0)” min_height=”500px” height=”500px” max_height=”500px” custom_margin=”||15px||false|false” animation_style=”slide” animation_direction=”left” animation_duration=”450ms” custom_css_main_element=”background: linear-gradient(90deg, #000000 10%, #a3afab 10%, #a3afab 90%, #000000 90%);” disabled=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_slide heading=”See it for what it is” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”46px” header_font_size_phone=”39px” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

If someone is trying to pressure you to send nudes, ummm red flag. Lines like ‘‘You’d send one if you really liked me” or “We aren’t having sex, so why can’t we just send some?” are not cool.

Sending nudes is a type of sexual activity that should never, ever be pressured. Even if you’re super into each other.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”How about no” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”45px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

First up, you’re 100% allowed to say ‘no’. Whether you’re in a relationship or not, sending nudes is not a give-in. So if you’re not into it, make it a clear no: “Sorry but no”, “Nah”, “How about No”, or just plain “No”.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Consent” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”47px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

No one should get your nudes without your ‘100% hell yeah’ kinda consent! When there’s any kind of force, pressure, or coercion, note to self: this does not equal consent.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Ignore” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”47px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

If you don’t even want to reply to a request for nudes, you don’t have to. #seen.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Be straight up” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”47px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]You may feel bad for turning someone down, especially if you really like the person. You don’t have to be savage while saying no (sometimes it helps though 😊). Try being honest and letting them know how you feel – they might respect you for it in the long run. “Hey, I think you’re really cool, but no, I’m not comfortable with that.”[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Use humour” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”47px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

It can be a bit intimidating saying a straight up no, especially if your super into someone.

So, if humour feels right for you, check out these funny GIFS to help you say you’re not into it: ZIPIT and gifs HERE.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Rally some support” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”47px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|tablet” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

Having a second pair of ears and a shoulder to lean on is super helpful, especially when someone’s pressuring you.

Talk to a trusted mate or adult if you’re needing some support. The counsellors at 1737 are great for support too.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Legal downlow” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”46px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

If you say no and someone won’t listen, you can just block them. If they keep pushing or even start threatening or blackmailing you, that’s sexual harassment.

It sounds intense, but you can also report them by ringing the police (111). It’s easy to downplay things, but it can get out of hand pretty quick. It’s important that you put your safety first.

[/et_pb_slide][/et_pb_slider][husk_tips_section_slider tips_section_post_id=”4788″ disabled_on=”off|off|off” _builder_version=”4.6.5″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][/husk_tips_section_slider][et_pb_text disabled_on=”on|on|off” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#414143″ text_font_size=”24px” text_orientation=”center” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_padding=”||8px||false|false” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}”]

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#ffffff” text_font_size=”28px” text_line_height=”1.2em” background_color=”#59848d” background_enable_image=”off” background_size=”contain” transform_rotate=”0deg|0deg|3deg” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”35px|20px|35px|20px|true|true” animation_style=”zoom” animation_direction=”left” animation_duration=”500ms” animation_delay=”400ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”83%” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” custom_css_after=” content: ”;|| position: absolute;|| left: 0;|| top: 80%;|| width: 0;|| height: 0;|| border: 32px solid transparent;|| border-right-color: #59848d;|| border-left: 0;|| border-top: 0;|| margin-top: -16px;|| margin-left: -32px;||” global_colors_info=”{}”]If the idea of someone else mysteriously getting your nudes keeps you up at night – abort mission, do not send. [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”3_4,1_4″ module_id=”feeling-pressure” module_class=”tabs-tab tabs-tab-scroll-to-top” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” width_tablet=”” width_phone=”95%” width_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_margin=”0px||||false|false” custom_padding=”4px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”3_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#0a0a0a” text_font_size=”24px” background_color=”#e0c874″ custom_padding=”10px|39px|10px|36px|true|false” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: ‘trashhand’;||display: inline-block;” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_css_main_element_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_main_element_phone=”font-family: ‘trashhand’;||display: block;||text-align: center;” custom_css_main_element_tablet=”font-family: ‘trashhand’;||display: inline-block;”]

Feeling pressure to send nudes?

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#000000″ text_font_size=”30px” text_line_height=”1em” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”||6px||false|false” custom_padding=”0px|0px||0px|false|true” text_text_color_last_edited=”off|desktop” text_font_size_tablet=”” text_font_size_phone=”28px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” text_orientation_tablet=”” text_orientation_phone=”center” text_orientation_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: %22trashhand%22;” global_colors_info=”{}”]

If you’ve been asked to share a nude by someone, but don’t want to, here’s some tips and tricks…

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_slider use_bg_overlay=”off” use_text_overlay=”off” arrows_custom_color=”#ffffff” disabled_on=”on|on|on” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0)” min_height=”500px” height=”500px” max_height=”500px” custom_margin=”||15px||false|false” animation_style=”slide” animation_direction=”left” animation_duration=”450ms” custom_css_main_element=”background: linear-gradient(90deg, #000000 10%, #a3afab 10%, #a3afab 90%, #000000 90%);” disabled=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_slide heading=”See it for what it is” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”46px” header_font_size_phone=”39px” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

If someone is trying to pressure you to send nudes, ummm red flag. Lines like ‘‘You’d send one if you really liked me” or “We aren’t having sex, so why can’t we just send some?” are not cool.

Sending nudes is a type of sexual activity that should never, ever be pressured. Even if you’re super into each other.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”How about no” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”45px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

First up, you’re 100% allowed to say ‘no’. Whether you’re in a relationship or not, sending nudes is not a give-in. So if you’re not into it, make it a clear no: “Sorry but no”, “Nah”, “How about No”, or just plain “No”.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Consent” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”47px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

No one should get your nudes without your ‘100% hell yeah’ kinda consent! When there’s any kind of force, pressure, or coercion, note to self: this does not equal consent.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Ignore” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”47px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

If you don’t even want to reply to a request for nudes, you don’t have to. #seen.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Be straight up” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”47px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]You may feel bad for turning someone down, especially if you really like the person. You don’t have to be savage while saying no (sometimes it helps though 😊). Try being honest and letting them know how you feel – they might respect you for it in the long run. “Hey, I think you’re really cool, but no, I’m not comfortable with that.”[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Use humour” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”47px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

It can be a bit intimidating saying a straight up no, especially if your super into someone.

So, if humour feels right for you, check out these funny GIFS to help you say you’re not into it: ZIPIT and gifs HERE.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Rally some support” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”47px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|tablet” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

Having a second pair of ears and a shoulder to lean on is super helpful, especially when someone’s pressuring you.

Talk to a trusted mate or adult if you’re needing some support. The counsellors at 1737 are great for support too.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Legal downlow” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”46px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

If you say no and someone won’t listen, you can just block them. If they keep pushing or even start threatening or blackmailing you, that’s sexual harassment.

It sounds intense, but you can also report them by ringing the police (111). It’s easy to downplay things, but it can get out of hand pretty quick. It’s important that you put your safety first.

[/et_pb_slide][/et_pb_slider][husk_tips_section_slider tips_section_post_id=”4800″ disabled_on=”off|off|off” _builder_version=”4.6.5″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][/husk_tips_section_slider][et_pb_text disabled_on=”on|on|off” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#414143″ text_font_size=”24px” text_orientation=”center” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_padding=”||8px||false|false” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Sending nudes is a sexual activity that should never be pressured. Even if you’re super into each other.[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”3_4,1_4″ module_id=”received-a-nude” module_class=”tabs-tab tabs-tab-scroll-to-top” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” width_tablet=”” width_phone=”95%” width_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_margin=”0px||||false|false” custom_padding=”4px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”3_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#0a0a0a” text_font_size=”24px” background_color=”#e0c874″ custom_padding=”10px|39px|10px|36px|true|false” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: ‘trashhand’;||display: inline-block;” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_css_main_element_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_main_element_phone=”font-family: ‘trashhand’;||display: block;||text-align: center;” custom_css_main_element_tablet=”font-family: ‘trashhand’;||display: inline-block;”]

Received a nude you didn’t want?

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#000000″ text_font_size=”30px” text_line_height=”1em” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”||6px||false|false” custom_padding=”0px|0px||0px|false|true” text_text_color_last_edited=”off|desktop” text_font_size_tablet=”” text_font_size_phone=”28px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” text_orientation_tablet=”” text_orientation_phone=”center” text_orientation_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: %22trashhand%22;” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Receiving a random nude might seem funny for some people, but for others it can feel really crap. If that’s you, here’s some steps to help you out…

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_slider use_bg_overlay=”off” use_text_overlay=”off” arrows_custom_color=”#ffffff” disabled_on=”on|on|on” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0)” min_height=”500px” height=”500px” max_height=”500px” custom_margin=”||15px||false|false” custom_padding=”0px||0px||false|false” animation_style=”slide” animation_direction=”left” animation_duration=”450ms” custom_css_main_element=”background: linear-gradient(90deg, #000000 10%, #a3afab 10%, #a3afab 90%, #000000 90%);” disabled=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_slide heading=”Be kind to yourself ” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”46px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

It’s okay for you to feel heaps of different things when you get an unwanted nude – embarrassed, curious, shameful, guilty, disgusted or aroused.

Whatever you feel is okay.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Tell them to stop” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”46px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|tablet” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

Be straight up. Ask the person to stop sending nudes – send them a text saying ’I think you’re cool (or not), but I’m not a fan of getting {dick/tit/butt} pics from you…”

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Feel crap? Yarn with a mate” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”46px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

Getting an unexpected nude can catch you off guard. It’s normal to feel a bit crap, especially if you didn’t ask for it.

Chat with a friend or even a trusted adult about it – they may be more understanding than you think.

If you’re feeling nervous, send a text: “Hey there, I just got a nude from someone that I didn’t ask for – and now I feel really weird about it – can we talk?”

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Dealing with feelings” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”46px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|tablet” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

Some people can feel really uncomfortable after getting an unwanted nude – and that makes total sense. These are legit feelings and it’s important to listen to them.

Check out FEELING UNCOMFORTABLE for some simple tips and tricks to process these feelings.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Take action” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” custom_padding=”0px||||false|false” header_font_size_tablet=”46px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

If someone keeps sending you nudes without your consent, this can be harassment under the Harmful Digital Communications Act – so you can take more action.

  • Block the profile/account and phone number of the person who sent it
  • Chat with the Netsafe crew and report the profile/account of the person
  • Keep a record of the pics. While deleting them feels good, it’s useful to screenshot the pics to show the police or Netsafe.
[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Don’t share it” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”46px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|tablet” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

Note to self: don’t on-share the nude with anyone else without their consent (you probably wouldn’t, but just playing it safe!)

[/et_pb_slide][/et_pb_slider][husk_tips_section_slider tips_section_post_id=”4803″ disabled_on=”off|off|off” _builder_version=”4.6.5″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][/husk_tips_section_slider][et_pb_text disabled_on=”off|off|on” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#414143″ text_font_size=”24px” text_orientation=”center” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_padding=”||8px||false|false” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}”]

It’s normal to feel heaps of different things… ashamed, guilty, grossed out or even aroused – these are all legit feelings. [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”3_4,1_4″ module_id=”regret-sending” module_class=”tabs-tab tabs-tab-scroll-to-top” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” width_tablet=”” width_phone=”95%” width_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_margin=”0px||||false|false” custom_padding=”4px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”3_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#0a0a0a” text_font_size=”24px” background_color=”#e0c874″ custom_padding=”10px|39px|10px|36px|true|false” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: ‘trashhand’;||display: inline-block;” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_css_main_element_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_main_element_phone=”font-family: ‘trashhand’;||display: block;||text-align: center;” custom_css_main_element_tablet=”font-family: ‘trashhand’;||display: inline-block;”]

Regret sending a nude?

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#000000″ text_font_size=”30px” text_line_height=”1em” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”||6px||false|false” custom_padding=”0px|0px||0px|false|true” text_text_color_last_edited=”off|desktop” text_font_size_tablet=”” text_font_size_phone=”28px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” text_orientation_tablet=”” text_orientation_phone=”center” text_orientation_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: %22trashhand%22;” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Some people send nudes and it’s all good times for them – but that’s not the case for everyone. If you’ve got regrets, here’s some tips to help…

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_slider use_bg_overlay=”off” use_text_overlay=”off” arrows_custom_color=”#ffffff” disabled_on=”on|on|on” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0)” min_height=”500px” height=”500px” max_height=”500px” custom_margin=”||15px||false|false” animation_style=”slide” animation_direction=”left” animation_duration=”450ms” custom_css_main_element=”background: linear-gradient(90deg, #000000 10%, #a3afab 10%, #a3afab 90%, #000000 90%);” disabled=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_slide heading=”Stay calm” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”46px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|tablet” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

Regret can get intense. It’s super easy to spin out and jump to the worst-case scenario “Nooooooo…will I end up on Pornhub?” Don’t spiral – in most cases, this doesn’t happen.

So try and stay calm – there’s stuff you can do, and there are people who can help.  Keep reading these tips for help…

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Be kind to yourself” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” header_font_size=”46px” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

If you’re feeling bad or regret it – don’t beat yourself up, when you send a nude you’re not usually thinking about further down the track.

Or even about the next day.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Take Action” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” header_font_size=”46px” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”46px” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

Hit up the person who you sent it to and ask them to delete it. If you can, watch them do it – and the sooner the better.

Or start with a text “I super regret sending that. Please delete it now and don’t share it.”

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”A problem shared is a problem halved” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” header_font_size=”46px” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”” header_font_size_phone=”43px” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

It sucks trying to deal with things alone. If you’re feeling low, reach out to some mates who care about you, or a whānau member or teacher you trust.

If you’re nervous, start with a text “Hey, can I talk to you about something? I sent a pic to someone and really regret it. I’m kind of freaking out.”

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Talk to the experts” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” header_font_size=”46px” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

Netsafe are pros when it comes to all things online.

They give free and confidential advice and options about what to do, including how to possibly get any images removed.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Legal downlow” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” header_font_size=”46px” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

Simply put, it’s illegal for nudes to be passed around without your consent.

That’s stated in The Harmful Digital Communications Act – so if your pic is shared without your consent, the law’s got your back.

Had a nude shared without your consent?

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#000000″ text_font_size=”30px” text_line_height=”1em” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”||6px||false|false” custom_padding=”0px|0px||0px|false|true” text_text_color_last_edited=”off|desktop” text_font_size_tablet=”” text_font_size_phone=”28px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” text_orientation_tablet=”” text_orientation_phone=”center” text_orientation_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: %22trashhand%22;” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Having a nude shared without your consent can be devastating, so here’s some tips to help out…

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_slider use_bg_overlay=”off” use_text_overlay=”off” arrows_custom_color=”#ffffff” disabled_on=”on|on|on” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0)” min_height=”500px” height=”500px” max_height=”500px” custom_margin=”||15px||false|false” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=”” custom_padding_last_edited=”on|desktop” animation_style=”slide” animation_direction=”left” animation_duration=”450ms” custom_css_main_element=”background: linear-gradient(90deg, #000000 10%, #a3afab 10%, #a3afab 90%, #000000 90%);” disabled=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_slide heading=”Take a deep breath” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” header_font_size=”46px” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

It’s so normal to feel yuck and like your world is caving in if you’ve had a nude shared without consent. You might also feel betrayed – especially if the nude was first sent to someone you trusted.

So, take a breath and be kind to yourself – feeling scared or out of control is normal.  But there’s help!

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”First step: Un-tag” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” header_font_size=”46px” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

If possible, un-tag yourself from the photo.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Being threatened? ” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” header_font_size=”46px” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

If the person you sent the nude to is using it against you as a form of control or blackmail, or as a threat if you decide to leave a relationship, that’s not okay! It can leave you feeling worried, anxious or depressed.

Talk to a trusted friend or call the Pros at Netsafe for support and to talk though options.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”LGBTIQ+ peeps” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” header_font_size=”46px” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

There may be additional fear or worry if the person threatening you is also saying they are going to out you.

Call or webchat with the team at Rainbow YOUTH or OUTline for awesome LGBTIQ+ friendly support.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”When to get the police involved” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” header_font_size=”46px” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

If you feel unsafe because someone is blackmailing, manipulating or threatening to share your nudes, that’s serious.

Contact Netsafe or the Police (111) for further help. Or if you want to anonymously report it to the police click here. 

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”A problem shared is a problem halved” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” header_font_size=”46px” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”” header_font_size_phone=”43px” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|tablet” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

This stuff can be niggly to navigate alone. Chat to someone you trust like a mate, whānau member or someone more removed, like a coach.

If you think they may freak out, start with a text: “Hey, I really need to chat, but I don’t want to be judged. I sent a nude to someone and now it’s been shared. I’m really freaking out.”

HERE are some more ideas about how to have this convo

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Talk to the experts” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” header_font_size=”46px” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

Netsafe are pros when it comes to all things online. They give free and confidential advice and options about what to do, including how to possibly get any images removed.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Report it” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” header_font_size=”46px” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” header_font_size_tablet=”” header_font_size_phone=”” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

Reporting the profile/account of the person who’s shared your content is important so that Facebook, Instagram, YouTube or Twitter etc can remove it.

To find out how to do that, click here… Facebook; YouTube; Twitter; Instagram

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Keep track” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” header_font_size=”46px” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

Immediately deleting your pics seems like the quickest solution, but it can help to have a record of them.

Screenshot the pic/vid and make a record of the URL. Instructions on how to do this are here Netsafe.

[/et_pb_slide][et_pb_slide heading=”Legal Downlow” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_align=”left” header_font_size=”46px” body_text_align=”left” body_font_size=”17px” background_enable_color=”off” background_layout=”light” custom_css_slide_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_transition=”on”]

It’s illegal to share nude imagery of someone without their permission.

If a nude has been shared without your consent, the law is on your side. The person can be fined up to $50,000 or face a prison sentence of two years for breaking laws covered in the Harmful digital Communications Act. Ouch.

What is a Nude?
A nude is the term used to describe a photo of a person showing part or all of their nude body. The term is also used alongside ‘sexting’ which is used to describe sending ‘nudes’, ‘underwear shots’ ‘dirty pics’ or sexual text messages or videos.[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/selfie-xs.png” title_text=”selfie-xs” show_bottom_space=”off” disabled_on=”off|on|on” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” width=”40%” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”0px||0px||true|false” custom_margin_tablet=”” custom_margin_phone=”||26px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_padding=”0px||0px||true|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text module_class=”body-text” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#414143″ custom_margin=”0px||20px||false|false” custom_padding=”0px||0px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]
Can I send someone my own nude without asking them first?
  • If you’re thinking of sending a nude to someone – you need to check they want it before you hit send.
  • Once you send a nude, you’ve lost control of it – and it can be easily shared/posted and difficult to remove, so check out thinking about sending a nude
  • If you’re over 16yrs and send a surprise nude to someone under 16yrs – you can get yourself in a bit of a legal jam because this is illegal under the New Zealand law.
  • If you send nudes to someone who doesn’t want to receive them – this could be counted as ‘harassment’ under The Harmful Digital Communications Act.
  • If you’ve already sent a nude to someone without asking them and are freaking out – talk to Netsafe, they’re the pros and can offer free confidential advice.

Interesting Fact: A NZ Netsafe study showed that females were more likely to report unwanted digital communication than males – and non-heterosexual young adults were more likely to be targeted.

Can I share someone else’s nudes/videos?

If you want to share or trade someone else’s nudes, here’s some things to consider before you press SEND:

  •  Consent  – Be 100% sure the person has said okay (given their full consent) before you share.
  •  Once you’ve hit SEND, you can’t unsend it  – If the person in the pic hasn’t given consent, it can be super damaging for them. And you. Word can get out, people can be hurt, a lot of damage can be done, and people can talk smack . They can also contact whoever they want – your family, your teachers or the police to try and get it removed.
  •  Regret  – Even if the person consents at the time, they also might regret it later. Nudes are super personal and its really common for people to change their mind or regret sending nudes. So, if you want to play it safe, don’t share.
  • Age Alert  – Sharing nudes with anyone under 16; if you’re 16 or over; or if the person in the pic is under 16 is illegal under the harmful digital communications act. If you’ve already done this, contact Netsafe for help.

What if I’ve already shared someone’s nude without their consent?

If you have shared a nude of someone without their consent, here’s some steps you can take:

  • Delete the nude immediately.
  • Contact the people/platforms you’ve shared it with and ask them to delete it.
  • Contact Netsafe if you can’t take it down yourself for confidential information and support.
  • Talk to a trusted friend or adult to support you.
[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/nudes-lines.png” title_text=”nudes-lines” align=”center” disabled_on=”off|on|on” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” transform_rotate=”0deg|0deg|9deg” width=”51%” max_width=”85%” custom_margin=”-71px||16px||false|false” custom_padding=”0px||0px||true|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text module_class=”body-text” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” link_text_color=”#b89a54″ custom_margin=”0px||40px||false|false” custom_padding=”0px||0px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]
Can I get my nude removed from a site?    

Most sites have great policies around someone posting images without your consent.

For e.g. Twitter, Instagram and YouTube have procedures in place and will generally remove a pic/video if it’s found to be ‘abuse’ or ‘sensitive imagery’ which violates their policies. Screenshot where you’ve seen it and save the URLs.

Here’s some links to reporting sections:

  • Instagram
  • Twitter 
  • Youtube

How do I safely send a nude/video?

If you’re sure you want to send a nude, you’ve considered all the points in thinking about sending nudes and you trust the person you’re sending it to (now and later), then there’s a few things you can do to lower the risks…

  • Firstly, keep your face out of the pic. This way, if it ends up being shared, other people may not know it’s you.
  • Make sure there’s nothing in the image that identifies you like your room, your house, your clothing or a mirror in the background (duh).
  • Tell the person you send it to that you don’t want (consent to) it being shared with anyone or posted anywhere. This might still happen, but it’s good to be clear.

More questions about Nudes? Check out: Icon or Netsafe

What’s “revenge porn”?

“Revenge porn” is a term used when someone shares a nude or video without the person’s consent or is using it against them, to control them, to bully them, as blackmail or as a threat. People with a physical disability and LGBTIQ+ young people are more likely to experience revenge porn, which is not okay(8).

If this sounds like what you’re experiencing, talk to a trusted friend immediately and call the Pros at Netsafe and they can help support you and talk though options. For LGBTIQ+ friendly services reach out to Rainbow YOUTH and OUTline.
